privacyPolicy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how Vortex (a brand operated by SatoshiPay Ltd) collects and processes personal data when you use our websites, apps, widgets, and related services (collectively, the "Services"). It replaces earlier versions and will be updated as our Services evolve.

1.description: SatoshiPay operates Vortex's web/app frontends and determines the purposes and means of processing personal data for the Services described here.

independentControllers.label: Independent controllers (local partners).
independentControllers.text: For on-/off-ramping, we work with licensed local payment partners who act as independent controllers for their own onboarding (e.g., KYC/KYB), fiat accounts, and payouts. See Section 7 for the current partner list and links to their policies.

processors.label: Processors.
processors.text: We also use vetted vendors (e.g., cloud hosting, analytics) as processors under data processing agreements. See Section 8.

1.title: 1. Who we are (Controller)

items.2: the Vortex Buy & Sell Crypto App and Vortex Widget
items.3: API and backend services that we operate for partners

2.note: It does not cover services operated solely by our local partners; they provide their own privacy notices and consents where required.
2.title: 2. Scope

3.intro: We collect the following categories of personal data, depending on how you use the Services:

contactData.label: Contact data:
contactData.text: e-mail address (for account/security verification and service communications).

cookiesData.label: Cookies/analytics data:
cookiesData.text: only with your consent where required (see Section 11).

supportData.label: Support data:
supportData.text: information you provide in requests (e.g., messages, attachments).

transactionData.label: Transaction metadata:
transactionData.text: order identifiers, corridor, asset type (e.g., stablecoin, token), amounts, and status. We do not custodially hold your private keys. On-chain transactions are public by design.

usageData.label: Usage & device data:
usageData.text: IP address, device/browser information, language, timestamps, referral URLs, and server logs.

3.title: 3. What data we collect

emailNote.label: E-mail addresses for service only.
emailNote.text: We store e-mail addresses to provide the Service (e.g., verification, transaction notifications, recognizing returning users across rails). This does not require marketing consent. To prevent misuse, we may send a verification e-mail to confirm control of the address.

4.intro: We process personal data for the following purposes and legal bases under the GDPR:

1.examples: initiate and complete conversions; display rates; route transactions

2.examples: verification e-mails; status updates; security alerts

4.examples: ensuring corridors operate within applicable rules; audit logs (we do not run KYC/KYB)

6.legalBasis: Art. 6(1)(a) (consent). We do not send marketing e-mails without explicit opt-in.

4.title: 4. Why we process data (purposes & legal bases)

items.1: Directly from you (e.g., input fields, support).
items.2: Automatically via your device/browser (IP, logs, cookies subject to consent).
items.3: From local partners, limited to what is necessary to operate a corridor (e.g., transaction status). Partners conduct KYC/KYB on their systems under their policies.

6.intro: We share personal data only as needed to run the Services:

legal.label: For legal reasons:
legal.text: if required by law, regulation, or to protect rights, safety, and integrity of the Services.

partners.label: With independent local partners (controllers):
partners.text: to execute on/off-ramp flows (e.g., payout confirmation). Partners use your data under their own policies and legal bases.

processors.label: With processors:
processors.text: for hosting, analytics, communications, and support tooling under data processing agreements.

6.noSale: We do not sell personal data.
6.title: 6. Sharing and disclosures (overview)

futurePartners.label: Future partners (blanket clause).
futurePartners.text: To provide the Services, we may add or replace local partners. We will update this list upon material changes and, where legally required, notify users. Even if a partner is not yet listed here, personal data may be shared where necessary to provide the requested on-/off-ramp service.

7.intro: These partners operate in their own jurisdictions for fiat collection/payout and related compliance. They may collect additional data directly from you. Please review their terms and privacy notices.
7.title: 7. Local partners (independent controllers)

internationalTransfers.label: International transfers.
internationalTransfers.text: Where data is transferred outside the EEA/UK, we use EU Standard Contractual Clauses and/or rely on adequacy decisions (e.g., EU-US Data Privacy Framework) as applicable, plus supplementary safeguards.

8.intro: We use reputable vendors under data processing agreements (DPAs):

cloudHosting.label: Cloud hosting & infrastructure:
cloudHosting.text: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Render, Netlify, Supabase.

8.title: 8. Processors (service providers)

9.intro: We retain personal data only as long as necessary for the purposes above:

cookies.label: Analytics cookies:
cookies.text: per your consent; retention managed by the provider.

logs.label: Logs:
logs.text: typically up to 12 months, unless needed longer for security or legal reasons.

serviceData.label: Service & security data:
serviceData.text: for the lifetime of the account/relationship and for a limited period thereafter (e.g., up to 24 months after last activity) for troubleshooting and compliance support.

9.legalRetention: We may retain information as required by law (e.g., tax/audit) or to establish, exercise, or defend legal claims.
9.title: 9. Retention

10.complaint: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority.
10.text: Under applicable law (e.g., GDPR/UK-GDPR), you may have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict, or object to processing, and to data portability. You may withdraw consent at any time (for activities based on consent). To exercise rights, contact
10.title: 10. Your rights

11.googleAnalytics: Google Analytics: IP anonymization is enabled. For opt-out tools and details, see
11.intro: We use cookies for essential functionality and, with your consent, for analytics. You can manage cookie preferences in your browser or via our cookie banner.
11.title: 11. Cookies & analytics

12.text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures, including encryption in transit, access controls, and monitoring. No internet service can be 100% secure; we work to detect and mitigate incidents promptly.
12.title: 12. Security

13.text: We update this policy when necessary. The "Last updated" date and version appear at the top. For material changes (e.g., new categories of data, new purposes, or new key partners), we will provide a clear notice and, where required, seek consent.
13.title: 13. Changes to this policy (versioning)

14.alternative: If you prefer, you may also contact SatoshiPay Ltd at its registered address listed above.
14.text: For questions about this policy, data requests, or complaints, contact:
14.title: 14. Contact

privacyPolicy.title: Vortex Privacy Policy

termsAndConditions.intro: These Short Terms provide a high-level summary of how Vortex operates. They are legally binding. A detailed version of the Terms (<1>"FULL TERMS & CONDITIONS"</1>) is available and applies in full.

1.text: Vortex provides a technical routing and aggregation layer for fiat–crypto and crypto–fiat transactions. Vortex is not a bank, payment institution, exchange, broker, custodian, or wallet provider. Transactions are executed by regulated third-party partners.
1.title: 1. Nature of the Service

2.text: Vortex never holds customer fiat funds or crypto-assets. Funds move between the user's wallet/bank and the relevant third-party partner.
2.title: 2. No Custody

3.text: All required KYC, KYB, AML, and transaction monitoring is performed by Vortex's regulated partners and their compliance providers. If verification fails, transactions may be blocked or reversed.
3.title: 3. Compliance & KYC

4.text: All prices are shown as quotes and may change. A transaction is only final once confirmed by the payment partner and blockchain settlement.
4.title: 4. Quotes, Execution & Finality

5.text: Fees are displayed before confirmation. Third-party banking, blockchain, or processing fees may apply. Promotional pricing may change at any time.
5.title: 5. Fees & Pricing

6.text: Crypto-assets and exchange rates are volatile. Blockchain transactions are generally irreversible. Users bear full market, execution, and technical risk.
6.title: 6. Technology & Market Risk

7.text: Users are solely responsible for determining and paying any applicable taxes. Vortex does not provide tax advice.
7.title: 7. Taxes

8.text: Vortex may suspend or modify services at any time due to maintenance, compliance, liquidity, or regulatory requirements.
8.title: 8. Service Availability

9.text: The Services must not be used for illegal activity, sanctions violations, fraud, money laundering, terrorism financing, or other prohibited conduct.
9.title: 9. Prohibited Use

10.text: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Vortex is not liable for indirect, consequential, or market-related losses.
10.title: 10. Limitation of Liability

11.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of [●]. Disputes are subject to the courts or arbitration specified in the Full Terms.
11.title: 11. Governing Law

12.text: These Short Terms are supplemented by the <1>Full Terms of Service</1>, Privacy Policy, and Partner Terms, which apply in full in all cases.
12.title: 12. Full Terms

termsAndConditions.title: Vortex Finance – Short Terms & Conditions

details.quoteChangedWarning: Your quote has changed. Please confirm the new output amount before proceeding.
details.title: Enter Details

business.answer: Absolutely! Vortex offers tailored solutions for businesses looking to integrate our platform into their services. Companies can provide their users with Vortex's competitive rates, ease of use, and seamless transactions. If you're interested, our sales team is ready to discuss how we can help meet your specific needs and set up a partnership that delivers value for your business.
business.question: Does Vortex offer solutions for businesses?

countries.answer: Vortex is available in all 44 European countries and also supports users in Brazil and Argentina. Our service coverage is constantly expanding, with new countries being added every few weeks. As we grow, we aim to provide access to even more regions and currencies to better serve our global users.
countries.question: Which countries and currencies does Vortex support?

cryptocurrencies.answer: Vortex supports a range of stablecoins, including USDC and USDT. These stablecoins are available on multiple blockchain networks, such as Polkadot, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BNB, Ethereum, and Polygon. We are constantly working to expand our offerings and will add additional cryptocurrencies and networks in the future to meet growing user demands.
cryptocurrencies.question: What cryptocurrencies are supported?

fees.answer: Vortex's fees are completely transparent and depend on the payment method you choose. These are all-in fees, meaning there are no hidden charges from Vortex or local banking partners. The cost of your transfer comes from the clearly disclosed fee and exchange rate. Unlike many providers that claim "no fees" but hide extra costs in inflated exchange rates, Vortex ensures you're never overcharged. Our fees are shown upfront so you always know exactly what you're paying.
fees.question: How much does Vortex charge in fees?

timing.answer: The crypto-to-fiat transaction process with Vortex is exceptionally quick, taking only about three minutes. If your bank supports instant payments, you'll see the funds in your account within five minutes. For banks without instant payment capabilities, the processing time depends on your bank, but it usually takes one to two business days for the money to arrive.
timing.question: How long does it take to sell crypto (for the money to arrive)?

verification.answer: Our KYC process is designed to be as fast and seamless as possible, usually taking less than six minutes to complete. In rare cases where additional checks are necessary, verification may take until the next business day. The time required largely depends on the validity and completeness of the documents provided. We recommend double-checking your submission to ensure a smooth process.
verification.question: How long does verification take?

feeComparison.description: The cost of your transfer comes from the fee and the exchange rate. Many providers offer <1>"no fee"</1>, while hiding a markup in the exchange rate, making you pay more.
feeComparison.description2: At Vortex, we'll never do that and show our fees upfront.

table.tooltip: Quotes are for Polygon, as the providers don't support {{network}}.

feeComparison.title: <0>Save</0> on exchange rate markups

gotQuestions.title:

whyVortex.description: Vortex is a non-custodial exchange that allows you to swap between different cryptocurrencies. It is built on top of the Stellar blockchain and uses the Stellar SDK to interact with the Stellar network.

lowFees.description: Fees are at just 0.25%, far below the market average. There are no hidden fees in the exchange rates.
